newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-St George cuts mortgage rates.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-St George cuts mortgage rates.

text.p: St George Bank Ltd said on Tuesday it plans to cut its standard variable home loan rate by 0.7 percentage points to 7.55 percent for owner occupier borrowers.
St George said the standard variable rate for investors would fall to 8.55 percent per annum. The rate cuts are effective February 25, for new borrowers and April 7 for existing customers.
It said the St George 'Loyalty Rate' for long term home loan customers and their immediate families, would fall to 7.3 percent for both owner occupier and investor borrowers from April 7.
St George also said it had cut its Great Australian Home Loan rate to 7.05 percent, down from 7.45 percent, for both occupier and investor borrowers, effective April 7.
It said it would introduce monthly administration fee for new loans of A$5 on its standard variable rate and A$8 on its Great Australian Home Loan, effective April 7.
These fees do not effect existing borrowers, it said.
